result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. 
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Eugene W. and Christopher W.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

208PM
State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Competency hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm. $1000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). DE previously ordered to have comp exam. ec
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.
Warrant sent to JS

3:06 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Samuel A Johnson not in court. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Samuel A Johnson. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Johnson does not have an explanation as to why the DE is not here, but advises the Court that the DE is chronically homeless. Based on the DE's non-appearance and for the reasons set forth on the record the Court forfeits bond and issues a bench warrant with $1000.00 cash bond. Prior bond will not be forfeited.

Submitted by WFU
RE:  Evaluation No Show

09:23 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.   No appearance by the Defendant. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. DE left a message for the Branch 2 clerk this morning stating that he could not make it to court at 8 am and would be requesting a new date. Attorney Johnson is requesting a new date as the DE has a scheduled appointment with the examiner. Court will adjourn to allow the competency report to be completed and filed. Competency hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
